lines.text:
[interviewing Brain Gremlin]
Creature what is it that you want?
civilization.
Yes, but what sort of civilization are you speaking of?

diplomacy, compassion, standards, manners, tradition... that's what we're reaching toward. Oh, we may stumble along the way, but civilization, yes. The Geneva Convention, chamber music, Susan Sontag. Everything your society has worked so hard to accomplish over the centuries, that's what we aspire to; we want to be civilized.
[a Gremlin with a beanie cap acts goofy next to Brain]
You take a look at this fellow here.
[Brain shoots the Gremlin in the head. The Gremlins in the bar laugh. Grandpa Fred and Kujitsu leave]

Now, was that civilized? No, clearly not. Fun, but in no sense civilized. Now, bear in mind, none of us has been in New York before. There are the Broadway shows - we'll have to find out how to get tickets. There's also a lot of street crime, but I believe we can watch that for free. We want the essentials. Dinettes. Complete bedroom groups. Convenient credit, even though we've been turned down in the past.
Elevator, sound alarm!
ENH! ENH! ENH! ENH! ENH! ENH! ENH!
All they have to do is to eat three or four children and there'd be the most appalling publicity.
Tonight, on the Clamp Cable Classic Movie Channel, don't miss Casablanca, now in full color with a happier ending.
They put me on at 3am. People who are awake at 3am aren't afraid of the Wolfman. The only thing that frightens those people is sobering up and going to work.
Gremlins? In this theater? Now?
[Gizmo is dressed like Rambo]
What happened to HIM?
I dunno. I guess they pushed him too far.
Because of the end of civilization, the Clamp Cable Network now leaves the air. We hope you've enjoyed our programming, but more importantly, we hope you've enjoyed... life.
[after being electrocuted the Gremlin starts to melt]
I'm melting. I'm melting. What a world, what a world...

[repeated phrase while on telephone in stock exchange]
BUY! BUY! BUY!

[repeated phrase while on telephone in stock exchange]
SELL! SELL! SELL!

[on telephone]
Well, it's rather brutal here. Right now we are advising all our clients to put everything they've got into canned food and shotguns.
Dr. Catheter, this just came for you.
Ah, splendid. This must be my malaria.
[sees it's not]
Rabies. I've got rabies, and I'm supposed to get the flu this week.
I think we have the flu out on back order.
[sneezes into tissue]
May I have that Peggy?
Sure.
Thank you.
[stuffs it into his pocket; muttering to himself]
Back order, back order. All a man wants is some fresh germs!

Okay you guys, listen up! People pay good money to see this movie! When they go out to a theater they want cold sodas, hot popcorn, and no monsters in the projection booth! Do I have to come up there myself? Do you think the Gremsters can stand up to the Hulkster? Well, if I were you, I'd run the rest of Gremlins 2! Right now! Sorry folks, it won't happen again.
[theater audience applauds and cheers]
Oh, why can't you commit?

[armed with drill]
Is it safe?
The Untamed Element, Oldest of Man's Mysteries, Giver of warmth, Destroyer of forests, right now *this* building is on fire.
What?
Yes! The building is on fire! Leave the building! Enact the Age Old drama of Self-Preservation!

[Screaming]
It's a rat.
Oh my God.
What's going on here? Did she say there was a rat?
No, she said there was no rat.
Gizmo ca-ca.
Peltzer, you're having a psychotic episode. Thank you for sharing it with us.
Nudie! Nudie! Nudie!
[enters elevator]

[a bit garbled]
Please state your desired floor.
Thirty-Eight
Thirty Eight. *Thirty Eight* *Thirty Eight!*
Going up.

[worried/unsure as the elevator starts going up at an alarming rate. The floor number indicator counts up faster and faster and soon passes floor 38, soon she panics]
Elevator stop!
[the elevator stops with a jolt]

[after a beat]
Sound alarm.

[imitating alarm]
Erhn! Ehrn! Erhn! Erhn!

[after a short while we are taken back to the scene where Kate is still stuck in the elevator worried]
HA HA HA

[Grabbing Kate's Legs]
Make a wish!

[Grabbing Kate's Hair]
Ah, Hair!

[talking gibberish and then one says clearly]
Going down.
[the elevator goes down at an alarming rate. Many gremlins are on the outside of the lift as it rushes down and then crashes splattering them into a green mush]

[all garbled up and dying as the doors open to reveal a couple and Kate about half a floor down inside covered with green gremlin blood]
The elevator doors have opened. Please watch your step.

[Kate looks around at the destruction and is left dazed]
Uh, Uh
We'll... we'll get the next one.
[Stopping Katsuji]
Hey, hey, hey. Can you work a TV camera?
Work a camera? I AM the camera.
Ow. I was just kidding. Ah. It's a ten. It's a ten.
This is a complete failure of management!
Long, isn't it?
Patently ridiculous.
Still lurking about? Don't you people have homes?

[after a gremlin drinks the brain formula]
Easy boy, nice boy... Now listen to me, I could get you diseases... you'd like that, wouldn't you?
[News reporters are being kept out of the Clamp building by the New York City Police]
Look, officer. Just let us in there. We'll take the responsibility.
Forget it, lady. Most of the people are out of there now.
Well, then what's in there. I've been to Beirut.
Yeah? I'll bet they miss you there.
It's just like I always say; if you want to find something weird you have to go downtown
Billy, if we get through today alive, you're in big trouble.
Would the owner of the car with license number 1AG 401 please remove it from the CLAMP parking garage, your car is old, and dirty.
Second floor, lingerie.
Sir, I'm... I'm sorry about the building.
I'm not.
You're not?
For one thing, we're insured for the damages. For another, maybe it wasn't a place for people anyway. It was a place for things. You make a place for things... things come.

[in elevator]
Going up!

[trapped in a giant spider's web]
Can I get some help here, please? I'm trapped in some sort of adhesive, polymer material and I'm on deadline!
The city so nice they named it twice! See it one time, won't you?

[sarcastically while looking at Gizmo]
Cute, isn't it?
We're not sure if that is genetic. No.
No, we're not.
I've got ordnance in here that will bring down a charging Puma at fifty feet!
[spits on Futterman]

[laughing hysterically]
Loogie!

[grabbing Kate's legs]
Make a Wish!
Hey, you two, the building's completely screwed up today.
Yeah, we know, Fred.
[Billy and Kate leave]

[smiling, chuckling to himself]
Heh heh, you're young. You know everything.
